reviewText: this was a great find on amazon to be able to watch a bbc program that i wasn't able to catch up on series in regular TV
Title: Bedlam: Series 2

reviewText: Not sure about the new approach to shows by the Brits. Tried and true is always best where they are concerned. For those thinking it may be something like Being Human, it misses the mark by a mile. The first series is awful and would never have bothered to keep watching had I not already purchased both series. Happily, the second series is better, with tighter and more cohesive stories. They got rid of the leads from the first and it generally works better all round, but is overall a huge disappointment.
summary: Well not up to usual British standard
Title: Bedlam: Series 2

reviewText: I finished watching season one of Bedlam and instantly bought season two. Low and behold the entire cast has been replaced! I've never seen a show where the whole cast is replaced, it's just strange. Something I've noticed with British shows is that they kill off the main characters almost always. I don't know if its to shock and awe their audience or if the production companies just can't hold onto their actors, either way, it makes for bad t.v. Definitely won't be watching anymore Bedlam.
Title: Bedlam: Series 2

reviewText: Season one was a little bit of a soap opera, trying to keep track of who was sleeping with whom. This season is much better, more like a proper ghost story. This was definitely an enjoyable use of a few hours.
Title: Bedlam: Series 2

reviewText: I was disappointed it was on the internet & had to wait till it came out to buy to see it. I think the show is in all good taste & I love the paranormal shows with substance.
Title: Bedlam: Series 2
